content: Yes, an engineering licentiate degree is suitable for those who want to pursue a career in research as it provides a deeper understanding of a specific field of engineering, and focuses on independent research work. It is also a good choice for those who wish to pursue a doctoral degree in engineering. However, if a person wants to focus more on practical engineering work or wants to gain advanced knowledge and skills in their field, a traditional master's degree in engineering would be a better fit for them. It is important to consider personal career goals and interests when deciding which type of engineering degree to pursue.
